story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: extreme_prestige
primary_trope.hook_text: Only a handful of races score 5/5 on Prestige. Unbound Gravel 100 is one.
primary_trope.mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) — knowing a perfect score exists but not why triggers dopamine anticipation.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Unbound Gravel 100? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Unbound Gravel 100 scored 74 out of 100. Elite tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Unbound Gravel 100. Emporia, Kansas. 104 mi. A 100-mile test through the Kansas Flint Hills. Leaves Emporia traveling north through Wabaunsee and Morris Counties. One checkpoint at Council Grove. Same brutal flint rock roads, rolling terrain, and open prairie as the 200. just compressed into a faster, more intense package.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Prestige. 5 out of 5. Bucket list tier. The name speaks for itself. Elite pros like two-time champion Tiffany Cromwell and Isaac Allred race the same terrain as everyday gravel fans in the same mass start. Experience. 5 out of 5. Once-in-a-lifetime course experience. The 6 AM mass start rolling 1,700 riders out of downtown Emporia creates the defining gravel experience. Community. 5 out of 5. The community IS the race. Emporia transforms into "Gravel City" with the town's population swelling 50% during race week. Length. 4 out of 5. Bring real food. Not just gels. Climate. 4 out of 5. Expect to be uncomfortable at some point. Kansas late spring brings extreme conditions. Adventure. 4 out of 5. Serious exploration vibes. Far from pavement. The Flint Hills provide stunning big sky country across America's last tall-grass prairie. Race Quality. 4 out of 5. The kind of race that spoils you for others. Life Time runs a professional operation with mass start police escort, neutral mechanics, and one well-stocked checkpoint at Council Grove. Field Depth. 4 out of 5. Stacked field. Fast riders everywhere. Strong elite field with pros like Tiffany Cromwell (2-time champion), Isaac Allred, and Hayden Christian.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Value. 4 out of 5. One of the better deals in gravel. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Gets the job done. Nothing fancy. Technicality. 3 out of 5. The course bites if you stop paying attention. Elevation. 3 out of 5. The hills sort the trained from the untrained. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Plan for a few hundred all-in. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

strengths: Manageable distance for first-timers to Unbound

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

weaknesses: Kansas weather can still be brutal
May feel like 'the other race' compared to 200

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: KCI - 2hr drive to Emporia; ICT - 1.5hr drive

Lodging: Hotels book out fast after lottery results. Many camp at Lyon County Fairgrounds. ESU residence halls sometimes available. Nearby towns like Olpe, Americus have options. HotelPlanner is official partner.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: The Gateway Drug. Yes if you want the world-class Unbound experience in a more accessible package. Yes if you're building toward the 200. Skip if lottery entry or Kansas weather are deal-breakers.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Unbound Gravel 100 isn't quite right for you. Unbound 200; SBT GRVL; Gravel Worlds
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Unbound Gravel 100? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic pose, 'Unbound Gravel 100' bold text, tier badge 'ELITE', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
